Time Sheets API#

This page highlights the different endpoints that are available to the web interface to interact with employee timesheet data.

Usage#

GET /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:#

An endpoint that retrieves the total employee hours and individual time sheets from the given date range.

param date_start

The start date of the time sheets to query in YYYY-MM-DD format.

param date_end

The end date of the time sheets to query in YYYY-MM-DD format.

status 200

When the total employee work hours are successfully retrieved and calculated.

status 400

When the employee ID, start date, or end date is invalid.

Example request:

GET /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:

URL: /api/v1/timesheet/jsmith317
Headers:
{
    "Authorization": "Bearer <access_token>"
}
Body:
{
    "date_start": "2022-03-01",
    "date_end": "2022-03-30"
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "status": 200,
    "message": "success",
    "data": {
        "total_hours": {
            "work_hours": 14,
            "pto_hours": 6,
            "extra_hours": 0
        },
        "time_sheets": {
            "2022-03-01": {
                "work_hours": 8,
                "pto_hours": 5,
                "extra_hours": 0,
                "date_worked": "2022-03-01"
            },
            "2022-03-02": {
                "work_hours": 6,
                "pto_hours": 1,
                "extra_hours": 0,
                "date_worked": "2022-03-02"
            },
            .....
        }
    }
}
POST /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:#

An endpoint to create a time sheet for an employee for a given date in YYYY-MM-DD format. It requires a list of records consisting of work hours, PTO hours, Extra/OT hours, and the date worked.

Parameters

  • employee_id – The employee ID of the employee.

  • time_sheets – The list of hours and the corresponding work dates.

Status Codes

  • 201 Created – When the employee time sheets are successfully added to the database.

  • 400 Bad Request – When the request body contains invalid parameters, or one or more employee time sheets already exist for a provided date.

Example request:

POST /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}: HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

Headers:
{
    "Authorization": "Bearer <access_token>"
}
Body:
{
    "time_sheets": [
        {
            "hours_worked": 8,
            "pto_hours": 0,
            "extra_hours": 0,
            "date_worked": "2022-03-01"
        },
        {
            "hours_worked": 8,
            "pto_hours": 0,
            "extra_hours": 2,
            "date_worked": "2022-03-02"
        },
        .....
    ]
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 201 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "status": 201,
    "message": "success",
    "data": {
        "time_sheets": [
            {
                "hours_worked": 8,
                "pto_hours": 0,
                "extra_hours": 0,
                "date_worked": "2022-03-01"
            },
            {
                "hours_worked": 8,
                "pto_hours": 0,
                "extra_hours": 2,
                "date_worked": "2022-03-02"
            },
            .....
        ]
    }
}
PUT /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:#

An endpoint that updates an individual time sheet of an employee on the given date with new hours.

param date_worked

The date of the time sheet to be updated in YYYY-MM-DD format.

param work_hours [OPTIONAL]

The Work hours that need to be updated.

param pto_hours [OPTIONAL]

The PTO hours that need to be updated.

param extra_hours [OPTIONAL]

The Extra/OT hours that need to be updated.

status 200

When the employee time sheets are successfully deleted for the given date.

status 400

When the request body is invalid, or the time sheet does not exist for the given date.

Example request:

PUT /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:

URL: /api/v1/timesheet/jsmith317
Headers:
{
    "Authorization": "Bearer <access_token>"
}
Body:
{
    "date_worked": "2022-03-01",
    "work_hours": 15
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "status": 200,
    "message": "success",
    "data": {
        "time_sheet": {
            "work_hours": 15,
            "pto_hours": 0,
            "extra_hours": 0,
            "date_worked": "2022-03-01"
        }
    }
}
DELETE /api/v1/timesheet:#

An endpoint that deletes all the time sheets of an employee.

param employee_id

The ID of the employee to remove time sheets from.

status 200

When the employee time sheets are successfully deleted.

status 400

When the request body is invalid, or the employee does not exist.

Example request:

DELETE /api/v1/timesheet

URL: /api/v1/timesheet
Headers:
{
    "Authorization": "Bearer <access_token>"
}
Params:
{
    "employee_id": "jsmith317"
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "status": 200,
    "message": "success",
    "data": {}
}
DELETE /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:#

An endpoint that deletes time sheets of an employee on the given dates.

param dates_worked

The list of dates of the time sheets to be deleted in YYYY-MM-DD format.

status 200

When the employee time sheet is successfully updated for the given date.

status 400

When the request body is invalid, or the time sheet does not exist for the given date.

Example request:

DELETE /api/v1/timesheet/:{employee_id}:

URL: /api/v1/timesheet/jsmith317
Headers:
{
    "Authorization": "Bearer <access_token>"
}
Body:
{
    "dates_worked": ["2022-03-01", "2022-03-02"]
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "status": 200,
    "message": "success",
    "data": {
        "time_sheets": [
            {
                "work_hours": 8,
                "pto_hours": 5,
                "extra_hours": 0,
                "date_worked": "2022-03-01"
            },
            {
                "work_hours": 6,
                "pto_hours": 1,
                "extra_hours": 0,
                "date_worked": "2022-03-02"
            }
        ]
    }
}

Implementation Documentation#

class server.web_api.routing.v1.employee_hours_routing.EmployeeHoursRouter#

Bases: object

class Create#

Bases: object

async static register_employee_time_sheets(employee_id: str, employee_time_sheets: server.lib.data_classes.employee_hours.PydanticEmployeeMultipleTimesheetSubmission, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to submit (and/or update) multiple time sheets for an employee with the work hours, pto hours, overtime/extra hours on a provided date. Front-end interaction is required to provide an employee ID, work hours, and a work date. Providing PTO hours and extra/overtime hours are optional and will default to 0 for the date if not provided.

Parameters

  • employee_id (str, required) – The ID of the employee

  • employee_time_sheets (PydanticEmployeeMultipleTimesheetSubmission, required) – A list of elements with each of them containing the following: the work date, the work hours for the provided date, and additional hours such as PTO or extra/overtime hours.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to retrieve all the employee data.

Returns

A response model containing the submitted timesheet consisting of the hours and the day worked.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided timesheet information is invalid, or the employee does not exist in the database.

class Delete#

Bases: object

async static remove_all_employee_time_sheets(employee_id: str, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to delete all the time sheets for a specified employee.

Parameters

  • employee_id (str, required) – The ID of the employee.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to update the timesheet data.

Returns

A response model displaying the success or failure of the deletion task.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided employee has no hours logged into the system, or the employee does not exist in the database.

async static remove_employee_time_sheets(employee_id: str, delete_employee_hours: server.lib.data_classes.employee_hours.PydanticEmployeeTimesheetRemoval, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to update the total work hours, pto hours, overtime/extra hours for an employee on a provided date. Front-end interaction can send requests to this endpoint with any valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

Parameters

  • employee_id (str, required) – The ID of the employee.

  • delete_employee_hours (PydanticEmployeeTimesheetUpdate, required) – The time sheets to delete on the provided date(s).

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to update the timesheet data.

Returns

A response model containing the deleted time sheets from the provided date(s).

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided employee has no hours logged into the system, or the employee does not exist in the database.

class Read#

Bases: object

async static read_employee_time_sheets(employee_id: str, date_start: str, date_end: Optional[str] = None, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to accumulate and return the total work hours, pto hours, overtime/extra hours for an employee within a provided date range. Front-end interaction can send requests to this endpoint with any valid date range, which would be useful for presenting total work hours over the course of a week, 2 weeks, a month, or a year.

Parameters

  • employee_id (str, required) – The ID of the employee.

  • date_start (str, required) – The starting date for the range of time sheets to query.

  • date_end (str, optional) – The ending date for the range of time sheets to query. If an ending date is not provided, it will only query the time sheets from the starting date.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to retrieve all the employee data.

Returns

A response model containing the total number of work hours, PTO hours, and extra/overtime hours from the days within the provided date range.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided employee has no hours logged into the system, or the employee does not exist in the database.

class Update#

Bases: object

async static update_employee_time_sheet(employee_id: str, updated_employee_hours: server.lib.data_classes.employee_hours.PydanticEmployeeTimesheetUpdate, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to update the total work hours, pto hours, overtime/extra hours for an employee on a provided date. Front-end interaction can send requests to this endpoint with any valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

Parameters

  • employee_id (str, required) – The ID of the employee.

  • updated_employee_hours (PydanticEmployeeTimesheetUpdate, required) – The date and the updated work/pto/extra hours.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to update the timesheet data.

Returns

A response model containing the updated total number of work hours, PTO hours, and extra/overtime hours for the employee on the given date.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided employee has no hours logged into the system, or the employee does not exist in the database.
